thread.title: Miller records first shutout of season as Canucks blank Kings
thread.title_full: Miller records first shutout of season as Canucks blank Kings

author: Greg Beacham
title: Miller records first shutout of season as Canucks blank Kings
text:
I forgot my password No thanks Oct 13, 2015; Los Angeles, CA, USA; Vancouver Canucks right wing Jake Virtanen (18) and Los Angeles Kings defenseman Drew Doughty (8) battle for the puck in the first period of the game at Staples Center. Mandatory Credit: Jayne Kamin-Oncea-USA TODAY Sports (Jayne Kamin-Oncea/USA Today Sports) Miller records first shutout of season as Canucks blank Kings Greg Beacham Los Angeles — The Associated Press 
Published Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015 6:32AM EDT 
Last updated Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015 6:34AM EDT 
Although Ryan Miller and coach Willie Desjardins refuse to get excited too early, the Vancouver Canucks are on an early-season roll through their Pacific Division opponents’ home buildings. 
Miller made 15 saves in his 36th career shutout, Adam Cracknell scored his second goal in two games, and the Canucks completed a Southern California sweep with a 3-0 victory over the winless Los Angeles Kings on Tuesday night. connect with us The Globe and Mail Newspaper
